alert.note: Alert for Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 11 at 10:22AM CDT until May 11 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WINONA AND SOUTHEASTERN WABASHA COUNTIES... At 1021 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Kellogg, or 9 miles south of Wabasha, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 10:18 am tennis ball sized hail was reported 4 miles north of Plainview. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Buffalo City around 1055 AM CDT. Alma around 1100 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Rattlesnake Ridge, Weaver, West Newton, Conception, State Road 42 And County 14, County Roads 18 And 4 and Minneiska. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
